title: Convert amounts into first equation
text: Let's use "q" as the number of quarters and "d" as the number of dimes. Because the number of quarters is $$3$$ more than $$2$$ times the number of dims, we can identify the first equation to be $$q=2d+3$$.
speech: Let's use "q" as the number of quarters and "d" as the number of dimes. Because the number of quarters is  3  more than  2  times the number of dims, we can identify the first equation to be  q is equal to, 2 d plus 3 .

times the number of dims, we can identify the first equation to be   q is equal to, 2 d plus 3

title: Convert amoutn into second equation
text: Because the total amount of money is $$\$8.55$$ and quarters are $$\$0.25$$ and dimes are $$\$0.10$$ we can determine that the second equation is $$0.25q+0.1d=8.55$$
speech: Because the total amount of money is  dollars 8.55,  and quarters are  dollars 0.25,  and dimes are  dollars 0.10,  we can determine that the second equation is  0.25 q plus 0.1 d is equal to 8.55

title: Plug in
text: We can plug in $$q=2d+3$$ using the second equation to get $$\operatorname{0.25}\left(2d+3\right)+0.1d=8.55$$
speech: We can plug in  q is equal to 2 d plus 3  using the second equation to get  0.25 of, parentheses, 2 d plus 3,  plus 0.1 d is equal to 8.55

using the second equation to get   0.25 of, , 2 d plus 3,  plus 0.1 d is equal to 8.55

title: Solve for a
text: We can determine that the second equation simplified would be $$0.6d+0.75=8.55$$. We now isolate the variable "d" and get $$0.6d=7.8$$. Then, we can divide both sides by $$0.6$$ to get $$d=13$$. There are $$13$$ dimes.
speech: We can determine that the second equation simplified would be  0.6 d plus 0.75, is equal to, 8.55 . We now isolate the variable "d" and get  0.6 d is equal to, 7.8 . Then, we can divide both sides by  0.6  to get  d is equal to 13 . There are  13  dimes.

title: Solve for c
text: After solving for "d", we can plug that value into the first equation to get $$q=2\left(13\right)+3$$ which we can determine $$n$$ to be $$29$$.
speech: After solving for "d", we can plug that value into the first equation to get  q is equal to 2 times 13 plus, 3  which we can determine  n  to be  29 .
